intro: Acrostichum hymenodiastrum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant features alternate, narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
